thread.title: Exporting agricultural knowledge set to be an industry of its own
thread.title_full: Exporting agricultural knowledge set to be an industry of its own

author: Nikolai Beilharz
title: Exporting agricultural knowledge set to be an industry of its own
text:
Map: Melbourne 3000 
Exporting agricultural knowledge could become a big industry alongside more traditional exports like coal and wool. 
According to the Australian Centre for International Agricultural Research (ACIAR), Australia has amongst the most advanced farming methods on the planet, due partially due a harsh climate necessitating extensive research and development. 
Andrew Campbell, CEO of ACIAR said his group was not involved in the selling of knowledge, but was part of the foreign aid portfolio. 
Mr Campbell said that working in long-term partnerships with groups like universities in the first instance was a good way to develop relationships. Audio: Andrew Campbell, CEO of ACIAR, discusses scientific diplomacy and exporting ideas. (ABC News) 
"For example, it might be lifting the performance in pulses, trying to deal with groundwater management in India or food safety in Vietnam. 
"Then we identify Australian research institutions, like the CSIRO or state government departments that have the relevant expertise, and we then commission them to work in that country to take those problems." 
Mr Campbell said that once Australia had helped a developing country with locally-developed technologies as a humanitarian gesture or 'soft diplomacy', it could become profitable after that. 
"Certainly we think that the science diplomacy that we undertake and have been doing for 30 years does open the way for Australian firms to work in these countries." 
"The relationship tends to evolve from one of aid, to one of partnership," he said. 
"We've seen that in China, for example, where in our work in inner Mongolia we're spending 25 Chinese dollars for every Australian dollar. 
"The Chinese still want us there, and they're happy to pay for it because of our expertise and because of the project management skills we bring."
